Package stocks.view

Interface PortfolioManagementView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PortfolioManagementViewImpl
    public interface PortfolioManagementView
    An interface to depict the different views that can be created. Functionality includes printing different tables, messages in different formats.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void printError​(java.lang.String msg)
      Displays an error message.
      void printMenu​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> menu)
      Displays a list of options in a menu style format.
      void printMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
      Displays a message.
      void printPortfolioComposition​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> portfolioComposition)
      A table that provides the composition of every stock in a portfolio.
      void printPortfolioPerformance​(java.lang.String portfolioName, java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double>> data)
      Prints a bar chart for a date range (y-axis) and the price of a portfolio (x-axis) with "*" as the basic unit to measure the amount the smallest amount.
      void printPortfolioValue​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> portfolioValuation, java.lang.String userDate)
      A table that provides the valuation of a stock for a given date.
      void printSuccess​(java.lang.String sc)
      Displays a message when an action is completed successfully.

      • printPortfolioValue

        void printPortfolioValue​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> portfolioValuation,
                         java.lang.String userDate)
        A table that provides the valuation of a stock for a given date.
        Parameters:
        portfolioValuation - Has a list of the stocks' attributes to be printed.
        userDate - The date for when the portfolio is valued.

      • printMenu

        void printMenu​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> menu)
        Displays a list of options in a menu style format.
        Parameters:
        menu - A list of options that have to be printed.

      • printPortfolioPerformance

        void printPortfolioPerformance​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                               java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double>> data)
        Prints a bar chart for a date range (y-axis) and the price of a portfolio (x-axis) with "*" as the basic unit to measure the amount the smallest amount. The performance is represented between 5 and 30 bars (y-axis) and 0 to 50 "*"s (x axis)
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio.
        data - has a list which provides a tuple of a date and the portfolio's value for a given date.
